content.prompt: In the final sentence of the passage, the narrator hopes that Mrs. Bloomfield is “rather weak than wicked” because the narrator wants to

choices.label: think of Mrs. Bloomfield’s behavior as unconscious rather than deliberate
retain her good opinion of Mrs. Bloomfield rather than forfeit it
curry Mrs. Bloomfield’s favor rather than lose it
view Mrs. Bloomfield as concerned with others rather than self-absorbed

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and describe details, diction, or syntax in a text that reveal a narrator's or speaker's perspective.
